intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subadsimilans, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters, often blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
